definition: canonical text/treasury (i.e. book of treasured wisdom)
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn

sentences.english: Let the woman keep, not equal to practiced a sunflower treasure Dian to calculate from the temple.
sentences.chinese: 让女人养吧，不如自宫练葵花宝典算了。

sentences.english: The six channels are classical documents of the Confucianists.
sentences.chinese: 六经是儒家宝典，都经过孔子之手。

sentences.english: Whatever it is it can pass into the family sayings and mythology.
sentences.chinese: 不管什么，都会成为家庭谚语或神话宝典哦。

sentences.english: He gathered earlier writings to prepare what are called the Five Classics.
sentences.chinese: 句型宝典他搜集以前的作品，编成了所谓的五经。

sentences.english: Mathematical Background: Foundations of Infinitesimal Calculus Second Edition, written by K. D.
sentences.chinese: 积分宝典，一本英文版的关于微积分的基础教程。

definition: secret book or collection of books
to hand down secret knowledge from generation to generation within a school or family etc
magical object/object symbolic of imperial power/fine weapon
the key trick/the secret of success
